sentence.Network_en: From her mother she inherited warmth of nature and dusky, semi - tropic beauty.
sentence.Network_cn: 她从母亲那儿秉承了热情的性格和亚热带的那种皮肤微黑的美.

sentence.Network_en: Face west, all you plump old men, and ponder your tropic fates.
sentence.Network_cn: 退休老人们啊, 面向西方, 为你们那莫测的祸福祈祷吧.

sentence.Network_en: She sorted out her things for tropic travel.
sentence.Network_cn: 她整理热带旅行的东西.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting the point on the ecliptic reached by the sun at the solstice): via Latin from Greek tropikos, from tropē 'turning', from trepein 'to turn'

means.word_mean: 1. either of two parallels of latitude about 23.5 degrees north and south of the equator representing the points farthest north and south at which the sun can shine directly overhead and constituting the boundaries of the torrid zone or tropics
1. relating to or situated in or characteristic of the tropics (the region on either side of the equator);
2. of weather or climate; hot and humid as in the tropics;

jushi.english: The coconut is particular to the tropics.

jushi.english: Darkness falls quickly in the tropics.
I went to the tropics for the first time last year.
